intro: Phacelia magellanica f. alpina, commonly known as the alpine phacelia, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a slightly serrated edge, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native environment.
